instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Tittle <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>

Not getting <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> after some trouble shooting noticed there is no voltage coming out of pin 3 of <CHIP>U7941</CHIP> which im assuming is preventing 5v to be created at <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>. since i am seeing P3V3S5 present i can only assume <CHIP>U7941</CHIP> is defective.

would like someone else's input before attempting to replace the component.

edit:replaced component nothing changed im actually getting 3.5 volts where 5volts should be present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> could also be pulling it down.
